codeSystems.name: BundleType
codeSystems.title: BundleType
codeSystems.description: Indicates the purpose of a bundle - how it is intended to be used.

codeSystems.title: ContactPointSystem
codeSystems.description: Telecommunications form for contact point.

codeSystems.name: ContactPointUse
codeSystems.title: ContactPointUse
codeSystems.description: Use of contact point.

codeSystems.name: HTTPVerb
codeSystems.title: HTTPVerb
codeSystems.description: HTTP verbs (in the HTTP command line). See [HTTP rfc](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231) for details.

codeSystems.name: IdentifierUse
codeSystems.title: IdentifierUse
codeSystems.description: Identifies the purpose for this identifier, if known .

codeSystems.name: MessageEvent
codeSystems.title: MessageEvent
codeSystems.description: One of the message events defined as part of this version of FHIR.

codeSystems.name: MessageSignificanceCategory
codeSystems.title: MessageSignificanceCategory
codeSystems.description: The impact of the content of a message.

codeSystems.name: messageheader-response-request
codeSystems.title: messageheader-response-request
codeSystems.description: HL7-defined table of codes which identify conditions under which acknowledgments are required to be returned in response to a message.

codeSystems.name: NameUse
codeSystems.title: NameUse
codeSystems.description: The use of a human name.

codeSystems.name: ProvenanceEntityRole
codeSystems.title: ProvenanceEntityRole
codeSystems.description: How an entity was used in an activity.

codeSystems.name: PublicationStatus
codeSystems.title: PublicationStatus
codeSystems.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

codeSystems.name: ResourceType
codeSystems.title: ResourceType
codeSystems.description: One of the resource types defined as part of this version of FHIR.

codeSystems.name: ResponseType
codeSystems.title: ResponseType
codeSystems.description: The kind of response to a message.

codeSystems.name: SearchEntryMode
codeSystems.title: SearchEntryMode
codeSystems.description: Why an entry is in the result set - whether it's included as a match or because of an _include requirement, or to convey information or warning information about the search process.

codeSystems.name: SNOMED_CT
codeSystems.title: SNOMED CT (all versions)
codeSystems.description: SNOMED CT is the most comprehensive and precise clinical health terminology product in the world, owned and distributed around the world by The International Health Terminology Standards Development Organisation (IHTSDO).

codeSystems.name: ContactEntityType
codeSystems.title: Contact entity type
codeSystems.description: This example value set defines a set of codes that can be used to indicate the purpose for which you would contact a contact party.

codeSystems.name: ContractSignerTypeCodes
codeSystems.title: Contract Signer Type Codes
codeSystems.description: This value set includes sample Contract Signer Type codes.

codeSystems.name: SecurityRoleType
codeSystems.title: Security Role Type
codeSystems.description: This CodeSystem contains Additional FHIR-defined Security Role types not defined elsewhere

codeSystems.name: ExampleMessageReasonCodes
codeSystems.title: Example Message Reason Codes
codeSystems.description: Example Message Reasons. These are the set of codes that might be used an updating an encounter using admin-update.

codeSystems.name: ProvenanceParticipantType
codeSystems.title: Provenance participant type
codeSystems.description: These codes define the type of participation by an agent in a provenance activity. An agent is something that bears the responsibility identified by the type of participation in the activity taking place, for the existence of an entity, or for another agent's activity. An Agent may be An agent, device, system, organization, group, care-team, or other identifiable thing.

codeSystems.name: UsageContextType
codeSystems.title: UsageContextType
codeSystems.description: A code that specifies a type of context being specified by a usage context.

codeSystems.name: IdentifierType
codeSystems.title: identifierType
codeSystems.description: HL7-defined code system of concepts specifying type of identifier. Used in HL7 Version 2.x messaging data types CX, PLN, PPN, XCN and XON.

codeSystems.name: ActReason
codeSystems.title: ActReason
codeSystems.description:
A set of codes specifying the motivation, cause, or rationale of an Act, when such rationale is not reasonably represented as an ActRelationship of type "has reason" linking to another Act.

*Examples:* Example reasons that might qualify for being coded in this field might be: "routine requirement", "infectious disease reporting requirement", "on patient request", "required by law".

codeSystems.name: ParticipationFunction
codeSystems.title: ParticipationFunction
codeSystems.description: This code is used to specify the exact function an actor had in a service in all necessary detail. This domain may include local extensions (CWE).

codeSystems.name: ParticipationType
codeSystems.title: ParticipationType
codeSystems.description: A code specifying the meaning and purpose of every Participation instance. Each of its values implies specific constraints on the Roles undertaking the participation.

codeSystems.name: RoleClass
codeSystems.title: RoleClass
codeSystems.description:
Codes for the Role class hierarchy. The values in this hierarchy, represent a Role which is an association or relationship between two entities - the entity that plays the role and the entity that scopes the role. Roles names are derived from the name of the playing entity in that role.

The role hierarchy stems from three core concepts, or abstract domains:

 *  **RoleClassOntological** is an abstract domain that collects roles in which the playing entity is defined or specified by the scoping entity.
 *  **RoleClassPartitive** collects roles in which the playing entity is in some sense a "part" of the scoping entity.
 *  **RoleClassAssociative** collects all of the remaining forms of association between the playing entity and the scoping entity. This set of roles is further partitioned between:
    
     *  **RoleClassPassive** which are roles in which the playing entity is used, known, treated, handled, built, or destroyed, etc. under the auspices of the scoping entity. The playing entity is passive in these roles in that the role exists without an agreement from the playing entity.
     *  **RoleClassMutualRelationship** which are relationships based on mutual behavior of the two entities. The basis of these relationship may be formal agreements or they may be *de facto* behavior. Thus, this sub-domain is further divided into:
        
         *  **RoleClassRelationshipFormal** in which the relationship is formally defined, frequently by a contract or agreement.
         *  **Personal relationship** which inks two people in a personal relationship.

The hierarchy discussed above is represented In the current vocabulary tables as a set of abstract domains, with the exception of the "Personal relationship" which is a leaf concept.

*OpenIssue:* Description copied from Concept Domain of same name. Must be verified.

codeSystems.name: RoleCode
codeSystems.title: RoleCode
codeSystems.description: A set of codes further specifying the kind of Role; specific classification codes for further qualifying RoleClass codes.

codeSystems.name: Ietf3066
codeSystems.title: Tags for the Identification of Languages
codeSystems.description: Older value from OID registry.  Superceded; see recommendations in BCP-47.

codeSystems.name: ISO3166Part1
codeSystems.title: ISO 3166-1 Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions — Part 1: Country code
codeSystems.description: ISO 3166-1 establishes codes that represent the current names of countries, dependencies, and other areas of particular geopolitical interest, on the basis of country names obtained from the United Nations.

codeSystems.name: Iso3166_2
codeSystems.title: ISO 3166 Part 2 Country Subdivision Codes
codeSystems.description: Identifies the coding system published in the ISO 3166-2 Standard for Country Subdivision codes. This standard is released periodically, and a new OID will be assigned by ISO for new editions.
